website_summaries.verdict: Runners who were able to wear the Merrell Nova were happy with what it had to offer. The overall build of this trail runner apparently accommodated the natural movement capacity of the foot. This product was also deemed suitably light and well-constructed. On the other hand, some runners bemoaned the midsole’s focus on natural pronation and the absence of a supportive feature for the midfoot.The Nova from Merrell is an addition to the worldwide family of trail running shoes. It is also a product intended for neutral pronators.
pros: People who have tested the Merrell Nova were happy with its lightweight build, stating that they never felt as though the product weighed them down
The underfoot cushioning system was appreciated for being responsive and comfortable
Many purchasers were happy with the looks of this running shoe, claiming that the color schemes were visually appealing
The fit profile was welcomed because it welcomed the foot without feeling too snug or restricting
Several testers commented that the flexibility of the product enabled natural and pleasant movements over the surfaces
The general quality of the materials received praise, with runners stating that the product lasted long
A lot of consumers liked the grip capacity of the Merrell Nova
they felt that they were able to ignore the fear of slipping and weave through the trails with confidence
cons: A few people lamented the lack of arch support, writing that the midsole didn’t avert any pronation concerns

customer_reviews.title: Terribly had heel support insert
customer_reviews.text: I made a big mistake, blisters on the first light (1 mile) run ... I know, I should have worn it before, just to see how it behaves. If you are not blessed with completely standardised feet better to keep away from these otherwise fine and cheap trail running shoes. Trail means you need more support, but running in a vice on your heels? Not my kind of fun to be honest. The heel support bit doesn't come up to all the way in the back, finishes abruptly, that was the source of the blisters for me. Also, wet socks from morning dew. I'll have to try some treatment before complaining more.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Delivered very next day excellent
customer_reviews.text: Came as expected,always buy these trainers or anything from Merrell a half size bigger. as they are always a little bit on the small side of sizes. if you get my meaning, thin socks only. But good quality gear, I have being buying Merrell for well over twenty + years and still not had a reason to complain about there product.
customer_reviews.author: Big Tommo

customer_reviews.title: ‘Shoe Zone’ insoles, worth 99p!
customer_reviews.text: Well built and good shape, however, the insoles are incredibly flimsy, cheap and tacky! Literally two walks in the park and the left one came detached, sliding up the heel while walking! Not hopeful for running on these! Will try to glue, or else, I’ll return them! Absolutely ridiculous, had so much expectations from this firm!
customer_reviews.author: The Man Who

customer_reviews.title: Good comfy shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Been walking during the lockdown and found theses very comfy. Third pair I’ve bought. I’d have to say there’s a wee bit of a squeak coming from this pair which didn’t happen with the others. However that may sort itself out in time

customer_reviews.text: Been using Merrells for a long time but these ones the build is pretty cheap and nasty may think about changing my brand

customer_reviews.text: very disappointed with the product. I wore the runners 4 times for walking only. Not running, not off road. They are already starting to fall apart and are not waterproof. Cant return them cause they are more than a month old. Never again

customer_reviews.title: Great trainers
customer_reviews.text: Great trainers. Very comfortable. Only issue is the material of the main shoe let's in cold air.

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction
customer_reviews.text: Appalling upper which started tearing at the joint where rubber meets fabric well before any wear to the sole.
customer_reviews.author: Jon M.

customer_reviews.title: Value
customer_reviews.text: I got them for work, I liked them that much I got another pair for casual use. Very nice
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not very wide yo front for ya toes
customer_reviews.text: A little stiff, not much room for toes to spread out and the heel to toe seems massive. Well made though. If had more space for toes and zero drop these would be a really good shoe. Iv did 3 x 10 mile runs in them and Arches of feet ache at mile 5. maybe down to shoe restricting my feet from natural movement? I won’t buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel

customer_reviews.title: Slip in the wet
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for walking the dog. They are very light and comfortable, especially if you have wide feet. They are not the best looking shoe I've ever had either. The one major drawback is that they are useless in damp conditions! Not only are they not in the slightest bit waterproof they slip like crazy on damp surfaces. Now I've had Vibrim soles before and I don't remember any such problems but if you intending walking on anything even resembling damp you'r toes will be slipping back the whole time! Putting them away till the summer... When I'm sure they will be great.... hopefully.
customer_reviews.author: Colonel Tom

customer_reviews.title: Good look, feel and support.
customer_reviews.text: Really good. My second pair of Merrells. Great off-road running shoe. Happy with the look, feel and support.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Suitable fitted
customer_reviews.text: A little bit thin but as expected very good and nice
